PageTitle: arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable
FuncDef:
The arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable command enables the alarm function for ARP packets discarded by DAI.
The undo arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable command disables the alarm function for ARP packets discarded by DAI. The arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable command enables the alarm function for ARP packets discarded by DAI. The undo arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable command disables the alarm function for ARP packets discarded by DAI. By default, the alarm function for ARP packets discarded by DAI is disabled.
CLIs: arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable
undo arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable
ParentView: Layer 2 100GE interface view,Layer 2 10GE interface view,Layer 2 200GE interface view,25GE-L2 view,400GE-L2 view,Layer 2 50GE interface view,Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface view,Layer 2 GE interface view,VLAN view,Bridge domain view,Interface group view
Examples: [*HUAWEI-100GE1/0/1] arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable
ExtraInfo: After DAI is enabled, if you want the device to generate an alarm when a large number of ARP packets that do not match binding entries are discarded, run the arp anti-attack check user-bind alarm enable command. When the number of discarded ARP packets exceeds the alarm threshold, the device generates an alarm.
